text: The AFC U-20 Women's Asian Cup is an association football tournament for women's national teams under the age of 20, organized by the Asian Football Confederation (AFC). It is organised by the Asian Football Confederation every two years, and serves as a qualifying competition for the FIFA U-20 Women's World Cup. It was first played in 2002 as the AFC U-19 Women's Championship with an upper age limit of 19. Starting from the 2022 edition, the age limit was raised to 20. ==Results== ===Under-19=== Edition Year Host Final Final Final Third place match Third place match Third place match Edition Year Host Champions Score Runners-up Third place Score Fourth place 1 2002 2–1 4–1 2 2004 3–0 4–0 3 2006 1–0 3–2 4 2007 1–0 1–0 5 2009 2–1 1–0 6 2011 round-robin round-robin 7 2013 round-robin round-robin 8 2015 0–0 4–0 9 2017 1–0 3–0 10 2019 2–1 9–1 ===Under-20=== Edition Year Host Final Final Final Third place match Third place match Third place match Edition Year Host Champions Score Runners-up Third place Score Fourth place 11 2022 ==Performance by country== Nation Champions Runners-up Third Place Fourth Place align=left 6 (2002, 2009, 2011, 2015, 2017, 2019) 1 (2007) – 2 (2006, 2013) align=left 2 (2004, 2013) 1 (2009) 2 (2015, 2019) 2 (2007, 2011) align=left 1 (2007) 6 (2006, 2011, 2013, 2015, 2017, 2019) 2 (2004, 2009) 1 (2002) align=left 1 (2006) 1 (2004) 5 (2002, 2007, 2011, 2013, 2017) 2 (2009, 2015) align=left – 1 (2002) – – align=left – – 1 (2006) 2 (2017, 2019) align=left – – – 1 (2004) ==References==
